Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic pottery floral band cup; interior glazed black except for reserved band at junction of rim and body; exterior: lip black; in handle zone interlaced palmette and lotus frieze with added white on lotus petals; repair hole near rim.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vessel as Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA222b.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0493) (Phase 1)
